coref: A Farmer walked through A Farmer field one cold winter morning. On the ground lay a Snake, stiff and frozen with the cold. A Farmer A Farmer knew how deadly a Snake could be, and yet A Farmer picked a Snake up and put a Snake in A Farmer bosom to warm a Snake back to life. a Snake soon revived, and when a Snake had enough strength, bit the man who had been so kind to a Snake. The bite was deadly and A Farmer A Farmer felt that A Farmer must die. As A Farmer drew A Farmer last breath, A Farmer said to those standing around: Learn from my fate not to take pity on a scoundrel.
